abstract: Opponents of same-sex marriage seem determined to carry on their fight regardless of Supreme Court's pending decision on issue; legal and political experts suggest, however, that swelling support for same-sex unions across much of country is likely to overwhelm opposition in select states over time and limit options for conservative holdouts determined to spurn same-sex couples.
lead_paragraph: Many legal and political experts say they do not expect the kind of backlash that followed decisions on school desegregation and abortion.

headline.main: Opponents of Gay Marriage Ponder Strategy as Issue Reaches Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Options Few for Opponents on Marriages

snippet: Many legal and political experts say they do not expect the kind of backlash that followed decisions on school desegregation and abortion.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
